tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE WaterQualityData (
  sensor_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  location VARCHAR NOT NULL,
  ph_level FLOAT NOT NULL,
  chlorine_level FLOAT NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE sensor_readings (
   reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   sensor_id INT,
   reading_value FLOAT,
   reading_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
   FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES sensors(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE sensors (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    installation_date DATE,
    calibration_date DATE,
    source_id INT NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE readings (
    reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT NOT NULL,
    reading_value FLOAT NOT NULL,
    reading_time TIMESTAMP,
    CONSTRAINT fk_sensor FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES sensors(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE alerts (
    alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    reading_id INT NOT NULL,
    alert_message TEXT,
    alert_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    CONSTRAINT fk_reading FOREIGN KEY (reading_id) REFERENCES readings(reading_id)
);

CREATE TABLE WaterQualityReadings (
	sensor_id INT,
	reading_time TIMESTAMP,
	ph_level DECIMAL,
	temperature DECIMAL,
	dissolved_oxygen DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE Sensors (
	sensor_id INT,
	sensor_location VARCHAR(50),
	measurement_type VARCHAR(50),
	sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
	installed_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE Locations (
	location_id INT,
	location_name VARCHAR(50),
	latitude DECIMAL,
	longitude DECIMAL,
	description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE Measurements (
	measurement_id INT,
	sensor_id INT,
	measurement_time TIMESTAMP,
	measurement_value DECIMAL,
	measurement_type VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE Users (
	user_id INT,
	username VARCHAR(50),
	email VARCHAR(50),
	created_date DATE,
	last_login TIMESTAMP
);
